Column Comment.0: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.1: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.2: ABBREVIATION: abbreviated form of the stratigraphic unit name.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.7: CONFIDENCE IDENTIFIER: the confidence that the interpreter has in this paleo agedefinition.
Column Comment.8: CURRENT STATUS DATE: the date that the current status of the stratigraphic unitcame into effect.
Column Comment.9: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the stratigraphic unit. A full description may becaptured in the table STRAT UNIT DESCRIPTION if desired.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the stratigraphic unit came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.12: FAULT TYPE: Usage of this column will be evaluated by future work groups todetermine how it should be used (or deprecated) in the model.
Column Comment.13: FORMATION CODE: code given to the formation name.
Column Comment.14: GROUP CODE: Code identifying a group of formations.
Column Comment.15: LONG NAME: Common long name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.16: ORDINAL AGE CODE: A number that indicates the age of a stratigraphic unit relativeto others in the same strat name set. Higher numbers are older than lower numbers.This column may be used to assist in locating all stratigraphic units older or youngerthan a specified unit.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: PREFERRED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that this stratigraphic unit is apreferred unit within the stratigraphic name set, and should be used when possible.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: narrative remarks about the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.20: SHORT NAME: short name for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.22: STRATIGRAPHIC INTERPRETATION METHOD: Interpretation method - surfacesample, sub-surface, logs, seismic, etc.
Column Comment.23: STRATIGRAPHIC STATUS TYPE: the status of the stratigraphic unit, such aswhether the strat unit is currently in use, obsolete, replaced etc.
Column Comment.24: STRATIGRAPHY TYPE: The category of stratigraphy that the STRAT UNIT isdescribed within, such as lithostratigraphic, chronostratigraphic, biostratigraphic,radiometric etc.
Column Comment.25: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT TYPE: The type of stratigraphic unit, often described interms of its position in a hierarchical scale, such as Eon, Epoch, Bed, Formation etc.May also be fault, thrust sheet, unconformity, surface etc.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
